fields_of_interest: Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Single market, Regional Policy, Climate Action
inter_groups:
Long-term Investment and Re-industrialisation Intergroup (as Renovate Europe) 
Urban Intergroup (as Renovate Europe)
eu_initiatives: EuroACE represents the interests of its members vis-à-vis EU energy efficiency policy. The main priority of EuroACE is currently the EU Climate and Energy Framework 2030, the Energy Efficiency Directive, the Governance Regulation, the Energy Performance of Buildings Directive, the 2050 Low Carbon Economy Roadmap, and the MFF post 2020.
organisation_name: The European Alliance of Companies for Energy Efficiency in Buildings (EuroACE)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: Eco-Design Consultation Forum/ Enterprise and Industry + Energy#E01798#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=1798#Member#C
membership:
• Official Partner of BUILD UP portal 
• Founding member of the European Energy Efficiency Industrial Forum (EEIF) 
• Member of Coalition for Energy Savings (the Coalition) 
• Member of European Council for an Energy Efficiency Economy (eceee) 
• Member of FAIB (Federation of International Associations in Belgium)
relevant_communication: EuroACE runs a highly successful campaign - the Renovate Europe Campaign (www.renovate-europe.eu) - that calls for an 80% reduction in energy demand of the building stock in the EU by 2050
goals__remit: The mission of EuroACE is to work together with the European institutions to help the EU move towards a more efficient use of energy in buildings, thereby contributing to European goals on job creation, economic growth, energy security and climate change.
